newsitem.title: USA: Washington state school district to resubmit bond.
newsitem.headline: Washington state school district to resubmit bond.

text.p: The Renton School District in King County will resubmit a $107 million bond measure to voters in early 1998, according to a published report on Monday.

The Seattle Post-Intelligencer reported that the school district and county have agreed to delay the local election until next year because of legal issues that could have jeopardized an election this spring.
King County Superior Court Judge George Finkle had initially ordered the county to rerun the election at county expense in March or May, the newspaper reported.
But in a decision last week, Finkle approved the new election date and again ordered the county to pay the cost of the election, the newspaper said.
The decision resolves a legal dispute between the district and King County over irregularities in an election the district narrowly lost in 1996.
The $107 million bond measure, if approved by voters in 1998, would pay for school district improvements.
